instructions.para: Values for this property are taken from the LC Subject Headings list (LCSH) at http://authorities.loc.gov or http://id.loc.gov.
For images, use LCSH only when TGM has no appropriate term to describe the resource.
Separate multiple headings with a semi-colon.
Values in this property are taken from the LC Subject Headings list (LCSH) at http://authorities.loc.gov or http://id.loc.gov.
For images, use LCSH only when TGM has no appropriate term to describe the resource.
Separate multiple headings with a semi-colon.
Values in this property are taken from the LC Subject Headings list (LCSH) at http://authorities.loc.gov or http://id.loc.gov.
For images, use LCSH only when TGM has no appropriate term to describe the resource.
Separate multiple headings with a semi-colon.

customization.para: Leave empty; UW Libraries catalogers will provide LSCH subjects.
Be sure to enter the value "xyz" in the "Cataloging" field to alert catalogers that these items need subject headings.
Values for this property will be taken from the LC Subject Headings list (LCSH) at http://authorities.loc.gov or http://id.loc.gov.
Multiple headings will be separated with a semi-colon.
topical headings and headings for places with proper names which are not entered in the Geographic Coverage field below (this includes neighborhoods) will be entered here..
Leave empty; UW Libraries catalogers will provide LSCH subjects.
Be sure to enter the value "xyz" in the "Cataloging" field to alert catalogers that these items need subject headings.
Values for this property are taken from the LC Subject Headings list (LCSH) at http://authorities.loc.gov or http://id.loc.gov.
Separate multiple headings with a semi-colon.
Leave empty; UW Libraries catalogers will provide LSCH subjects.
Be sure to enter the value "xyz" in the "Cataloging" field to alert catalogers that these items need subject headings.
Values for this property are taken from the LC Subject Headings list (LCSH) at http://authorities.loc.gov or http://id.loc.gov.
Separate multiple headings with a semi-colon.
Leave empty; UW Libraries catalogers will provide LSCH subjects.
Be sure to enter the value "xyz" in the "Cataloging" field to alert catalogers that these items need subject headings.
Values for this property are taken from the LC Subject Headings list (LCSH) at http://authorities.loc.gov or http://id.loc.gov.
Separate multiple headings with a semi-colon.
University of Washington Libraries (UWL) cataloging staff will provide a value or values for this property.
For metadata creation taking place outside the UWL Cataloging and Metadata Services unit:
Do not provide a value for this property.
Be sure to provide the value 'xyz' for the Cataloging property to indicate to cataloging staff that a value is needed.
For textual resources, be sure to record a staffNotes value which provides the needed information for UWL cataloging staff to perform subject analysis.
For details about the information needed by cataloging staff, contact the collection manager(s) or metadata liaison(s).
University of Washington Libraries (UWL) cataloging staff will provide a value or values for this property.
For metadata creation taking place outside the UWL Cataloging and Metadata Services unit:
Do not provide a value for this property.
Be sure to provide the value 'xyz' for the Cataloging property to indicate to cataloging staff that a value is needed.

For oral histories, be sure to record a value for the Index property which provides needed information for UWL cataloging staff to perform subject analysis. Cataloging staff may also use transcripts for subject analysis.
For details about the information needed by cataloging staff, contact the collection manager(s) or metadata liaison(s).

history.justification: We wanted a subject field that distinguishes LCSH headings from other subject headings, to get the full benefits of using a controlled vocabulary.

changeLog.change: changed //cdm/required to //cdm/cdmRequired and //cdm/uwRequired to assist in halting use of the cdm "required" feature while, at the same time, indicating that UW-cdm collections must use, or not use, a given property; also changed @xsi:schemaLocation.
Added info for krab; added info for cdm compound objects
Add customizations for the Sephardic Studies Digital Collection - p16786coll3
